comment_data.body:
You don't need to add the leading "+" sign to the numbers. Message broadcast works with JIDs, e.g.
31650568134@s.whatsapp.net

And message broadcasts also have a maximum number of targets, if I recall correctly according to the WP7 client it's max 20 targets per broadcast.

AND the person you are sending to WILL NOT get your message if the number they receive the message from is not in their contacts.

All the spammers must hate that!
Then how can i send message to multiple number, if they dont save my number ?

You don't.

The broadcast feature is NOT some sort of MASS MESSAGING system. It's a quick way to send the same message to around 20 of your friends without including them all in a group.

It's not a marketeering tool.

If you need to send to multiple people you'll just have to do a loop through your list and send each one individually. Of course depending on how many you send, you run the risk of having your number blocked.

I do not know how many you can send before you get blocked.

The reported numbers before block vary from 10 to 100, but I think that John has a good point here. Making sure that the recipients have your number in their contacts list may have a big influence on whether or not you get blocked.

Ok, Thanks John and Shirioko

But can you please write a loop for me so that i try to send message to all my friends. I am new in Php.

@harshaljha Coding is a lot of fun. Try to have a bash at it yourself, it feels good when you solve a problem!

Try reading these first too:

http://www.w3schools.com/php/php_looping_for.asp
http://php.net/manual/en/control-structures.for.php
http://php.net/manual/en/control-structures.foreach.php

Then show us some code and we'll help!

Ok thanks John

I will try but it is a suggestion that these feature should also be in this API to send message for multiple number.

I am using this 

$target = array(919********3, 919********23, 919********0);    

foreach ($target as &$value) {
    $value = $value * 2;
}
unset($value);   


And got this response -

array (size=0)
  empty

array (size=1)
  0 => 
    array (size=5)
      'mynumber' => string '91********53' (length=12)
      'from' => string 'Array@s.whatsapp.net' (length=20)
      'id' => string 'message-1373276065-1' (length=20)
      'type' => string 'chat' (length=4)
      'time' => string '1373276064' (length=10)

ha ha ha ha


Ok buddy.... I got your message.

title: Broadcast a message
